Subs are NOT hard coded. You can turn them off. Looks perfect quality but haven't had the time to watch through yet. And yadam is wrong, this is 720p.

FYI at first i thought this was a dud--it wouldn't play on my mac. it would hang up forever when loading in VLC. quicktime x with perian had audio but no video. finally, i tried mplayer and it worked just fine.

for those who complain about the big size (which is absolutely normal for a 720p film though)

http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/5187628/9_%28Nine%29_2009_720p_BluRay_nHD_x264_NhaNc3

Quality is superb, except 20mb oversize for DVD5 (wtf?) and video will freeze in the credits about 2 minutes before the end.



Fix for those who wish fit this into DVD5 by removing the bugged end credits: Get MKVtoolnix 3.4.0 and run "mkvmerge". Add MKV and go to "global" tab and "enable splitting". Select "...after this duration" and set value to "01:15:41". Hit "Start muxing" and wait...
